Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What sustainable or environmental practices have been implemented?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: From the text, it is not explicitly mentioned which specific sustainable or environmental practices have been implemented in connection with Earth Day celebrations, the United Nations Sustainable Development Agenda, or the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). However, based on the overall message of the text, it can be inferred that there has been increased awareness and emphasis on promoting sustainability, addressing environmental challenges, and achieving the SDGs within various educational institutions, including schools. Some possible examples of sustainable or environmental practices that could be implemented include reducing waste, conserving water and energy, adopting eco-friendly policies, encouraging recycling, using renewable resources, supporting local farmers and businesses, and incorporating environmental education into curriculums.

source.content: Each year on April 22 Earth Day is celebrated around the globe as it marks the anniversary of the modern environmental movement that started in  This year’s Earth Day theme is “Restore Our Earth” and will focus on tackling the challenges that face us with climate change What better way to discuss these challenges than through the lens of the United Nations Sustainable Development Agenda The United Nations Sustainable Development Agenda adopted in  includes seventeen Sustainable Development Goals SDGs to be achieved by  Countries around the world have committed to taking action to meet these goals such as making energy clean and affordable stopping global warming ending hunger and poverty and creating sustainable cities and communities At Participate Learning we are proud to join forces with organizations that champion the SDGs There are more than fifty million public school students in the United States and more than three million full-time public school teachers This collective group

teaching The classroom learning transforms The students transform locally and globally It’s a never-ending cycle of win-win What I think I love most about the global education journey is that it’s about transformation So how can you leap into the unknown and begin transforming your teaching There are several ways to do this But one of my favorite ways is through the Sustainable Development Goals because they were designed for transformation Here are answers to some of the most frequently asked questions so you can get started transforming your classroom with ease and confidence The Sustainable Development Goals SDGs are basically a giant “to-do” list of 17 goals that will help make the world better and more sustainable for all These goals were created in  with a target achievement date by  It’s truly amazing to see the impact these goals are having in our world and as an educator you’re in the perfect place to add even more impact These goals fit every content area enhance students’

The Sustainable Development Goals – also known as SDGs – are designed to bring people together to improve life around the world Created by the United Nations they are a set of common goals to help us overcome global challenges like poverty inequality climate change and more They seek to harmonize three core components for the future economic growth social inclusion and environmental protection SDGs have a huge part to play in today’s classrooms As a blueprint for making the world a better place these goals can help engage students and inform lesson plans Let’s take a look at the top 7 reasons why educators should make use of the SDGs in their classrooms Let’s start with an obvious one The SDGs have been specifically created to draw attention to some of the biggest environmental challenges in the world today Sanitation sustainability pollution and climate action are all addressed SDGs are about more than awareness though They also break down each goal into a set of achievable

ceramic waste This example may seem like too much for a school classroom but Participate Learning partner schools are implementing similar action-driven projects every day In Oxford North Carolina a class of elementary students became curious when they noticed the amount of uneaten food in their cafeteria Where does this food go This simple question led to an exploration of food waste both in their local school and around the world As a result students engaged in a class project to take action to reduce the food waste at West Oxford Elementary one of Participate Learning’s Global Leaders schools Wondering about the attitudes skills and knowledge that the students at West Oxford Elementary are developing Download the Profile of a Global Leader poster here When you first think about implementing global learning it can feel like a massive undertaking After all the world is a pretty big place You may feel like you have to make huge changes to everything you are doing in the classroom but

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: Are there any events or initiatives focused on environmental conservation? If yet then list 10 such events.
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
Yes, there are numerous events and initiatives focused on environmental conservation. However, providing a comprehensive list of all 10 events might not be feasible. Instead, I will mention some well-known events and initiatives related to environmental conservation. Some of these include:

1. Earth Hour (March/April)
2. World Environment Day (June 5th)
3. Global Climate Strike (September/October)
4. COP26 - United Nations Climate Change Conference (November 202)
5. International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) World Conservation Congress (every 2 years)
6. World Wildlife Day (March 3rd)
7. National Geographic Society's "Planet or Plastic?" Campaign
8. Greenpeace's various campaigns and actions
9. WWF's (World Wildlife Fund) conservation efforts and campaigns
10. The United Nations Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD) conferences and events

These are just a few examples of the many events and initiatives dedicated to environmental conservation.

of reducing waste You and your students can also use the gift of your time to volunteer at local organizations working in your community to end hunger Food pantries shelters that provide meals or organizations like Meals on Wheels are good starting points to see where you can help Be sure to also ask students for their own suggestions After learning about these issues students will probably have creative ideas for projects or campaigns that will help your community Through this type of action-driven learning students are empowered to use critical thinking and problem-solving skills to positively impact the world For more ways to connect the Thanksgiving holiday to core subject areas see the environmental impact of a Thanksgiving meal and Thanksgiving stories to start conversations in the classroom At Participate Learning we want to equip you as a global educator to build your students’ academic skills and global competencies We hope these ideas and resources will help you and your

As you plan out  be sure to make time for professional development whether you attend in person or virtually Our collected resources for teaching the UN’s Sustainable Development Goals Use the UN’s Sustainable Development Goals as a framework for global learning Zero Hunger and global learning Empowering students to make a difference Our top blog posts for Ambassador Teachers Explore the Participate Learning Blog for the latest updates in global education 10 Things to Know Before You Apply to Teach with Participate Learning

the future There is a wide array of subjects that teachers could explore to show the importance of sustainability such as Sustainability has huge relevance to the curriculum It crosses into science geography economics sociology and more It touches so much of our past present and future lives Introducing these sustainability subjects to classrooms can help build global leaders those who look beyond their own experiences and see how wider-reaching issues can impact the lives of those around them The UN’s SDGs play a key role in today’s education They provide a framework of shared goals that organizations across the globe can work towards to build a better future It brings together NGOs governments and educators and focuses them on that single purpose improving our planet and the lives of those on it At Participate Learning we’ve pulled together the resources needed for teachers to nurture tomorrow’s global leaders Our powerful global leadership framework will help students be more

Over 3 billion people currently live in cities and that number is projected to rise to 5 billion by  The shift presents huge challenges for infrastructure social development and more This is why the sustainability of cities and communities should be an important discussion point in classrooms today Forging sustainable cities and communities play a major role in our world’s future It’s at the heart of billions of daily lives It’s wide-reaching covering a huge variety of subjects – large and small – that touch everything we do It’s easy to draw direct links between sustainability and student life Consider the buses that transport students to school or the electricity that powers computers and lights homes Sustainability is something that affects all of us every day Students should be encouraged to explore the structures behind our day-to-day lives to understand their scope and impact They should be mindful of the challenges that are faced by those responsible for that infrastructure

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Has the organization made any public commitments to social or corporate responsibility?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Based on the information provided, it seems that Participate Learning has demonstrated a strong commitment to social and corporate responsibility. By focusing on interdisciplinary standards-based learning opportunities that contribute to addressing society's critical challenges, Participate Learning aligns its work with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). Additionally, the organization has been recognized as a "B Lab 'Best For the World'" organization every year since, which highlights its dedication to social and environmental impact. Furthermore, Participate Learning has partnered with other organizations that also prioritize social and corporate responsibility, such as B Corporations. Overall, based on the available information, it appears that Participate Learning is actively engaged in promoting social and corporate responsibility within its sphere of influence.

At the 4th Annual Multi-Tiered System of Support MTSS Learning Conference Maggie Murphy made a confession “Don’t tell the UN we added a goal” She is referring to the UN’s Sustainable Development Goals the framework she has been using to help her 7th- and 8th-grade students find their voices as global leaders who can change the world And the goal she and her class added Kindness Maggie Murphy teaches 7th and 8th graders at Piney Creek School located in a tiny community nestled in North Carolina’s Blue Ridge Mountains Piney Creek is one of two schools in Alleghany County that recently brought global learning to their community Maggie and her students have hit the ground running The school’s global program launched in August  As part of the school’s training and onboarding process we introduced our global leadership framework alongside the UN SDGs as a way for Piney Creek’s teachers to integrate action-based global learning into their curriculum My new poster is finished but my students

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Are there annual or quarterly reports detailing these commitments? If yes, then summarize.
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, there are annual and quarterly reports detailing these commitments. The annual report provides an overall summary of the company's performance, achievements, and future plans related to its sustainability goals. On the other hand, the quarterly reports offer more detailed updates on progress towards specific targets within those goals. Both types of reports include data and metrics to track the company's performance against its commitments.

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: What community or social events have been organized to fulfill these commitments?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: It seems that there has been a successful community event organized by the school in Alleghany County, North Carolina. This event included a school-wide read-a-thon, where students raised funds for animals and clean water, ultimately receiving an award for their efforts. Additionally, the school has implemented various educational initiatives aligned with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDG), such as dual language immersion programs, digital tool integration, and language assistance programs for English Language Learners (ELLs). Overall, these events and initiatives demonstrate the school's commitment to fostering a sense of community, promoting education equity, advocating for diverse perspectives, and encouraging civic engagement among its students and the wider community.

Commerce & Products.question: What products, services, or technologies are available?
Commerce & Products.result:
There are several products, services, and technologies mentioned in the provided context. Some of these include:

1. Participate Learning: A company offering purpose-driven, challenging work in a collaborative environment. They are committed to making a positive impact on both their employees and the community.
2. Flip's platform: A tool that enables teachers and students to communicate through prompts and replies, fostering collaboration and discussion among peers.
3. Google Earth: An interactive mapping tool that provides immersive experiences for students, allowing them to explore various locations around the globe.
4. Time lapses, 3D imagery, and other tools: These features within Google Earth enhance students' understanding of geography and terrain by providing visual representations of landscapes and environments.
5. Custom projects and activities: Educators can utilize platforms like Wordwall to create engaging, custom games and activities for their students.
6. Interactive whiteboards: Tools like interactive whiteboards enable teachers to create custom games and activities for students, promoting active participation and collaboration in the classroom.

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employment or educational opportunities are currently available?
Employment & Opportunities.result: There are several employment and educational opportunities mentioned throughout the text. For employment, there are positions available within Participate Learning such as School Support Coordinators, Regional Managers, and Program Directors. Additionally, there may be opportunities within the resources department, international admissions specialists, and local adviser programs. On the education front, there are middle school programs like Conexiones that focus on language proficiency, global competencies, and skills for the workforce. Furthermore, there are opportunities for professional development through courses and training sessions offered by Participate Learning. Lastly, there might be chances for individuals to teach abroad, particularly in the United States, through various programs provided by Participate Learning.

impact According to the World Economic Forum some of the top job skills students need are resilience stress tolerance and flexibility Students will deal with ambiguity and near-constant change in future work environments The ability to pivot and approach challenges with flexibility is important for students to practice Middle school students in the Conexiones program are building language proficiency global competencies and skills for the workforce like flexibility Through studying both language and culture students are exposed to different ways of thinking helping them to build resilience as they encounter new people and experiences Students also graduate from Conexiones proficient in another language a valuable hard skill in the future job market To experience future success students must learn how to think critically about the world around them The ability to challenge assumptions and apply logical thought processes will serve students well in a variety of situations  Global

Employment & Opportunities.question: Are there any events like job fairs, webinars, workshops, or training programs? If yes, list them.
Employment & Opportunities.result:
Yes, there are various events like job fairs, webinars, workshops, and training programs related to education and professional development. Some of these events include:

Job Fairs:

1. Education Job Fair (hosted by universities, colleges, and educational organizations)
2. Virtual Education Job Fair (online event connecting employers and job seekers in the education sector)

Webinars/Online Events:

1. EdTech Webinar Series (exploring innovation and trends in educational technology)
2. Professional Development Webinars (offering live and recorded sessions on various topics relevant to educators and professionals in the field)

Workshops/Training Programs:

1. Summer Institutes (providing intensive training and professional development opportunities during summer breaks)
2. Regional Conferences (bringing together educators and professionals within specific regions for networking, collaboration, and skill-building)

These events and programs cater to a wide range of interests and needs within the education community, providing ample opportunities for growth, collaboration, and networking.

source.content: Education conferences are a great way for teachers and administrators to learn new instructional strategies network with peers and be refreshed and rejuvenated As you plan out  be sure to make time for professional development whether you attend in person or virtually Below we have highlighted conferences for global and language educators plus general education conferences we think would be valuable for you Here are Participate Learning’s recommendations for can’t-miss conferences this year The North Carolina Association for Supervision and Curriculum Development is hosting its annual conference for educators across the state Hear from fellow administrators teachers and educators in more than 30 sessions as they share their best practices with you K-20 world language and dual language educators will not want to miss the Foreign Language Association of North Carolina’s annual conferences The Spring Conference in March is a recap of sessions from the Fall  Conference and includes site

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employee or participant benefits are highlighted?
Employment & Opportunities.result:
Employee/participant benefits highlighted include:

1. Health insurance coverage meeting US Department of State requirements, with Participate Learning covering a significant portion of the premium cost.
2. Airline tickets provided for transportation from home country airports to the US for orientation, as well as assistance with travel arrangements and itinerary communication.
3. A purpose-driven, challenging, and collaborative work environment within a flexible and open company culture.
4. Encouragement for employees/participants to pursue their professional and personal passions.
5. Recognition as a certified B Corporation and consistent designation as a "Best for the World" honoree.
6. Commitment to providing best-in-class service and support to partner schools and Ambassador Teachers, as reported by customer satisfaction surveys and net promoter scores.

source.content: for all program participants Participate Learning program participants and any accompanying J-2 family members are required by the US Department of State to have health insurance at certain minimum coverage levels To meet this requirement all teachers are enrolled in the same health benefits program through the entirety of their program participation Participate Learning pays a large portion of the monthly premium cost—however all teachers are also responsible for paying a portion of the monthly premium Participate Learning provides all teachers including co-teachers with airline tickets for transport from major airports in their home countries to the US for orientation Participate Learning arranges travel plans and emails itineraries prior to travel Additional travel during holidays or visits costs of travel for family and return tickets at the end of the program are purchased at the teacher’s expense Participate Learning is authorized by the US Department of State to sponsor

Participate Learning offers purpose-driven challenging work in a collaborative environment a flexible and open culture and encourage employees to pursue their professional and personal passions As part of our B Corp commitment one of the important measures of the success of our business is the positive impact we make on our employees We’re thrilled to be recognized for the ninth straight year as one of B Corps’ Best For The World Overall honorees in  This places Participate Learning in the top 10 of Certified B Corps across all impact areas Our work inspires everyone to be change agents bringing more empathy and connection to the world We are a proud Equal Opportunity Employer and Drug Free Workplace Are you interested in working with us Please review our open positions and submit an online application

At Participate Learning our mission is to unite our world through global learning Many of us are former teachers principals or school district leaders All of us believe that global education is a catalyst for changing lives We are proud to be recognized as a certified B Corporation B Corp since  and have been designated as a Best for the World Honoree since  As part of our B Corp commitment one of our success measures is the positive impact we make on our employees We do this by offering interesting challenging work in a collaborative flexible and open culture and encouraging employees to pursue their professional and personal passions along the way Since the beginning we have committed to providing best-in-class service and support to our partner schools and Ambassador Teachers We are pleased to share that our customers report a high level of satisfaction with our services based on our most recent survey as indicated by our Net Promoter Scores When asked ‘On a scale of  how likely are

Learning who are currently teaching on the program will receive the reward via payroll or check Participate Learning reserves the right to provide rewards via pre-paid credit or gift cards Rewards to Ambassador Teacher alumni will be sent only via a payment in the mail Payment can be mailed anywhere

Financials & Funding.result: Based on the information provided, there isn't any specific financial or earnings report mentioned. However, some general insights about Participate Learning can still be extracted from the text. Some notable points include David Young being named a top Impact CEO, Participate Learning having partnerships with schools worldwide, and the company's focus on creating shared prosperity and preparing students for success in the global marketplace. Additionally, the Uniting Our Staff Reunion served as an opportunity to strengthen staff connections, foster innovation, and gather input for future planning.

source.content: Canada Being together in one place provided invaluable opportunities to create new relationships with co-workers and strengthen already existing ones We kicked off our two days in the way that all good things start by sharing a meal and fellowship followed by a memorable opening activity Each staff member was challenged to silently line up according to their employment start date; then we passed around a microphone to see how we did Start dates ranged from the creation of the company in  all the way to just days before the reunion It was a fantastic visual representation of how both organizational experience and expertise from other institutions and industries make us strong  All staff had an opportunity at the reunion to provide input and perspective as Participate Learning works toward developing our next strategic plan With the support of an outside facilitator Lisa Cleri Reale from DoGoodery we collectively had the chance to guide the next iteration of our values think through how

David Young of Triangle-based NC Participate Learning has been named a top  Impact CEO Young is listed as 35 on the MO  Top Impact CEO Rankings which “celebrates leaders who are leveraging the engine of capitalism to create shared prosperity” according to Big Path Capital the firm that organizes the annual award Young has led Participate Learning since  building one of the top organizations providing global education opportunities to K-12 public schools Since its founding Participate Learning has partnered with schools and districts to develop language proficiency and cultural competencies that prepare students for success in the global marketplace “This award reflects all the great work by the team at Participate Learning—staff that commits to using their careers as forces for good We share this honor with the  schools that partner with us to implement global learning programs that positively impact hundreds of thousands of students teachers and community members each year” Young said

Each year Participate Learning holds an annual meeting in which we come together as a company to establish a common vision for the year to come This year’s staff retreat was the first in over three years As such the planning team decided to embrace the theme of coming together after a long absence reimagining the event as the Uniting Our Staff Reunion And what a reunion it was With eighty-two staff members descending on Durham from across the state country and globe we truly embodied our commitment to Uniting Our World After the long gap between meetings our goal this year was to build and deepen staff connections and create space for staff innovation and input while planning for our future Our company came together in its entirety including those who made the trip from the UK Costa Rica and Canada Being together in one place provided invaluable opportunities to create new relationships with co-workers and strengthen already existing ones We kicked off our two days in the way that all

this honor with the  schools that partner with us to implement global learning programs that positively impact hundreds of thousands of students teachers and community members each year” Young said Big Path Capital bases the rankings on a combination of each organization’s business performance and B Corporation scores an internationally recognized measurement from B Lab of an organization’s contribution to addressing society’s critical challenges Participate Learning has been listed as a B Lab “Best For the World” organization every year since  The MO  list includes leaders of firms in a wide range of industries including climate solutions clean energy sustainable and healthy food and equitable finance Companies represented include 3Degrees Grove Collaborative Luke’s Lobster Numi Pacha Soap Co and Okabashi The complete list can be found here

source.content: It’s truly amazing to see the impact these goals are having in our world and as an educator you’re in the perfect place to add even more impact These goals fit every content area enhance students’ academic understanding create a stronger school culture and build relevance for your teaching All you need to get started is you Don’t worry about having all the answers or all the background before you begin Start with a goal you’re naturally drawn to first As educators we are constantly aware of time or lack of it One of the great things about the goals is that they are connected to one another so learning and teaching about one will easily create an organic pathway to another goal This saves you time in the classroom but more importantly it builds relevance and deep meaning for your students There are many resources you can use to help build your understanding of the Global Goals Our sister company Participate Inc offers mini courses that are perfect for a teacher’s busy life But don’t

vital information about each goal in one place From extensive facts and figures to the individual targets that make up each goal the SDGs are useful classroom resources that adds depth and context to lesson plans They also contain links to further reading from sources such as the World Health Organization UNICEF and more The SDGs are not just a series of abstract ideals The goals themselves are SMART with clear time-limited targets that make up each SDG Many of these targets fall within the next couple of years with some of the larger-scale challenges set for  This helps educators to see not only which parts of the goal are most pressing but also what can be achieved even in a limited time frame As the SDGs show even making a small change can have a big impact on the world By ensuring that the goals are specific measurable attainable realistic and timely they can be used to give focus to classroom discussion It’s worth emphasizing that the SDGs are closely aligned with today’s

Here are a few of them with the SDG goal they align to These projects provided interdisciplinary standards-based learning opportunities for Maggie’s students In addition to analyzing and creating informational texts students used persuasive writing and math skills to fund-raise They developed marketing and social media skills to promote their causes Just as important as these skills though is the impact these students have had on their community So proud of these girls and our partnership with  Through this school wide read-a-thon we raised over 2 for animals and clean water to be sent around the world And we’re awarded Innovative School Award proudteacher SDG1 SDG2 SDG6 SDG11  Maggie’s students and I talked about the multiplier effect that their projects are already having in their community In a place like Alleghany County with a population of only 11 residents the contributions of Piney Creek’s students are not insignificant and they will continue to have an impact on their

that the goals are specific measurable attainable realistic and timely they can be used to give focus to classroom discussion It’s worth emphasizing that the SDGs are closely aligned with today’s curriculum They broach a remarkable range of traditional academic subjects such as geography biology social sciences politics economics and more Educators should see the SDGs as an opportunity to add extra depth to their lesson plans rather than being something that requires work to link to the curriculum At Participate Learning we place a lot of emphasis on the importance of nurturing global leadership in the classroom and the SDGs form the backbone of that We hope that this post has reinforced the value of these goals and the role that they can – and should – play in enriching lesson plans teaching the curriculum and showing the students of today that they have a role to play in the world of the future

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What organizations, institutions, or entities is the organization collaborating with?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
Based on the provided information, Participate Learning is collaborating with various organizations, institutions, and entities. Some notable collaborations mentioned include:

1. Schools that partner with Participate Learning to implement global learning programs that positively impact students, teachers, and community members.
2. Appalachian State University, with whom Participate Learning has formed a partnership to bring its Global Leaders framework to future leaders.
3. Other educational institutions and organizations that work closely with Participate Learning to develop personalized plans to infuse global learning into their curriculums (as mentioned in the last paragraph).
4. B Corporations, which Participate Learning is part of, allowing them to join a larger community of like-minded organizations working towards a common goal.
5. Organizations such as 3Degrees, Grove Collaborative, Luke's Lobster, Numi, Pacha Soap Co., and Okabashi, among others, which are represented in the "MO" list of companies contributing to societal challenges.

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: Are there any joint events, projects, or initiatives? If yes then list them.
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
Yes, there are several joint events, projects, and initiatives involving the mentioned individuals and organizations. Some notable examples include:

1. Banner displays in schools: Collaborative efforts between Participate Learning and its partners result in the creation and display of banners showcasing successful implementation and pathway progression. These banners serve as visual reminders of the achievements made possible by the partnerships.
2. Social media campaigns: To raise awareness and celebrate successes, Participate Learning and its partners collaborate on social media campaigns. By sharing stories and updates via platforms like Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram, they aim to inspire others and encourage further involvement in global education and leadership development.
3. Shout-outs: Recognizing the hard work and dedication of partners, Participate Learning and its team members often give shout-outs on social media or during meetings/events. This acknowledgment serves to strengthen relationships and maintain a spirit of collaboration.
4. Educational resources: Participate Learning works closely with its partners to develop and share educational resources, such as lesson plans, curriculum materials, and professional development opportunities. Through these resources, they strive to improve global education and empower students to become global leaders.
5. Community outreach: Participate Learning and its partners collaborate on various community outreach initiatives, such as hosting workshops, organizing events, and participating in local activities. These endeavors help promote global understanding, foster connections within the community, and demonstrate the collective commitment to making a positive impact.

source.content: for their accomplishments From banners to display in the school to social media campaigns and shout-outs we work alongside our partners to highlight and celebrate successful implementation and pathway progression Hear directly from some of our partners about the impact of partnering with Participate Learning to implement Global Leaders Teaching our students to be Global Leaders provides them with the opportunity to learn those soft skills through both the Global Competencies and the Sustainable Development Goals … With these initiatives we are creating Global Leaders who are well-rounded citizens; they are able to pay attention feel connected and take action Global Education is allowing our students the chance to solve problems make decisions think critically communicate ideas effectively and work well with others” Global leaders and global education are so important to me because I want to be able to affect change in our Johnsonville community Having an awareness of the world around

is the root cause of many of the other global issues we face Stephanie has received training in disaster response and preparedness and community engagement through the UNC-Chapel Hill Gillings School of Global Public Health and completed the Carolina Navigators service learning program focused on global education and intercultural competence Tiffany is an experienced educator who worked as a teacher for 14 years teaching elementary and middle school students During her career she played various roles including grade level leader cooperating teacher and providing professional development at the district and statewide level Tiffany found a sense of belonging within our shared values and celebration of diversity which provide opportunities for educators worldwide to promote awareness and compassion Tiffany’s passion for helping others is evident in her work and she is excited to see the positive impact of our collective efforts Krisya has been a part of Participate Learning since

Institute Program at University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill In  he was named to Momentum ’s Impact CEO list David has participated in numerous work and study abroad programs and has visited 50 countries and counting When he is not working David enjoys volunteering with Habitat for Humanity and working with the UN Sustainable Development Goals One the weekends he can be found on the soccer field where he takes great pride in being a fútbol dad Jake oversees our Product Implementation and Partnership departments to deliver high-quality research-backed solutions to our partner schools  Jake brings 23 years of education experience to Participate Learning He has worked as a World Language Teacher and as a Principal at both NC’s first stand-alone Newcomer’s School and at a Spanish Immersion School He also has district-level experience as the Executive Director of Instructional Technology and Innovation in Guilford County NC and the Chief Operations Officer and the Chief Academic

promoting peace tolerance and understanding Rocío is a dedicated educator who has taught for 36 years starting in preschool and moving on to elementary and middle school math As a former Ambassador Teacher who loved her experience she carries that enthusiasm into her current role where she helps teachers have a positive experience in the US with Participate Learning She is passionate about providing quality education to students and is committed to ensuring that teachers have the support they need to achieve this goal Stephanie is passionate about fostering global understanding and curiosity about other cultures and enjoys the way this aligns with her Bachelors degree in Global Studies and her work at Participate Learning She has a compelling interest in SDG 5 Gender Equality which she believes is the root cause of many of the other global issues we face Stephanie has received training in disaster response and preparedness and community engagement through the UNC-Chapel Hill Gillings

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What are the mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
The mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations include:

1. Highlighting and celebrating successful implementation and pathway progression.
2. Creating global leaders who are well-rounded citizens capable of solving problems, making deciding, thinking critically, communicating ideas effectively, and working well with others.
3. Ensuring Participate Learning's social mission drives the organization as a Certified B Corporation.
4. Providing opportunities for learners to connect, access resources, engage in discussions, and complete courses together.
5. Building and deepening staff connections, fostering innovation, and gathering input for future planning.
6. Helping teachers achieve their goals and providing guidance throughout the international experience.
7. Combining expertise and resources to combat human trafficking and promote global education.

source.content: for their accomplishments From banners to display in the school to social media campaigns and shout-outs we work alongside our partners to highlight and celebrate successful implementation and pathway progression Hear directly from some of our partners about the impact of partnering with Participate Learning to implement Global Leaders Teaching our students to be Global Leaders provides them with the opportunity to learn those soft skills through both the Global Competencies and the Sustainable Development Goals … With these initiatives we are creating Global Leaders who are well-rounded citizens; they are able to pay attention feel connected and take action Global Education is allowing our students the chance to solve problems make decisions think critically communicate ideas effectively and work well with others” Global leaders and global education are so important to me because I want to be able to affect change in our Johnsonville community Having an awareness of the world around

and positive social impact There is a growing community of more than 2 Certified B Corps from 50 countries and more than  industries working toward a unifying goal to redefine success in business As a B Corp Participate Learning is committed to ensuring our social mission drives our organization According to Wenger-Trayner “Communities of Practice are groups of people who share a concern or a passion for something they do and learn how to do it better as they interact regularly” They are a key component of effective professional development because learning is a social activity Together members learn and grow through regular collaboration With our sister company Participate Inc learners use an online space to connect access and share resources engage in discussions and complete courses together Educators who connect with colleagues outside their school community to create a professional learning network Connected educators learn new tools strategies and ideas that are reflected in

Each year Participate Learning holds an annual meeting in which we come together as a company to establish a common vision for the year to come This year’s staff retreat was the first in over three years As such the planning team decided to embrace the theme of coming together after a long absence reimagining the event as the Uniting Our Staff Reunion And what a reunion it was With eighty-two staff members descending on Durham from across the state country and globe we truly embodied our commitment to Uniting Our World After the long gap between meetings our goal this year was to build and deepen staff connections and create space for staff innovation and input while planning for our future Our company came together in its entirety including those who made the trip from the UK Costa Rica and Canada Being together in one place provided invaluable opportunities to create new relationships with co-workers and strengthen already existing ones We kicked off our two days in the way that all

compassion Tiffany’s passion for helping others is evident in her work and she is excited to see the positive impact of our collective efforts Krisya has been a part of Participate Learning since  working in various roles within the Admissions Department She has a background in business administration and customer service which has allowed her to support teachers through the application and certification process Krisya is passionate about bringing cultures together through education and international exposure She is proud to be a part of this mission and is motivated by the excitement of teachers to live this international experience Supporting their dreams and guiding them through the process is very rewarding for her Twitter  Linkedin With a background in combating human trafficking with an international nonprofit organization Fabiola brings a wealth of experience to her role as an International Admissions Associate Her previous work involved a diverse range of tasks from advocating
